translated: Birth Stories
The Fours🔽The Kāliṅga Group
The Shorter Kāliṅga Birth Story
“Open the door for the month of Vivarati,
Let them enter the city of Aruṇarāja;
With the lion well-trained,
Well-protected by Nandisenan.”
“Victory for the Kāliṅgas, unconquerable ones,
Defeat and misfortune for the Assakas;

analyzed: id ca iva te bhāsitam brahmacāri
translated: Thus it was spoken by you, celibate one,
The upright do not speak falsely.”
“The gods have turned away from false speech,
Truth is the supreme wealth among them, Śakra;
That was spoken falsely by you, king of gods,
Or what is the reason, Maghavā, Mahinda?”
“Didn’t you hear, brahmin, when it was said:
The gods do not interfere with human effort;
Self-control, concentration, and an unbreakable mind,
Not being heedless, and leaving at the right time;

analyzed: daḷham ca viriyam purisa parakkamo ca
translated: Strong effort, and human effort,
By that there was victory for the Assakas.”
The Shorter Kāliṅga Birth Story, the first.
